segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Ashley, what was it like outside when Vaelus was at her happiest?

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley)
segments.content: Oh. There was a lot of light, a lot of sun. Vaelus was always outside sunning, dancing, not a care in the world. Freer and lighter than we've seen her. The hope of youth, and she hasn't felt the loss and she just feels lighter and freer.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Something as light as a ribbon, made of pure silk, white and red and gold and blue twining and twining and twining in a dance, a massive, carved moss-covered pole as your sister Maywyn looks at you and goes, "One, two, three, one, two, three. Under and over and under and over." Braiding and braiding and braiding as you dance in this glade, moss under your bare feet and suddenly (whooshing, poof) a small globe of light as your brother, Arthas, "(grunts)" bam! Clothesline into your sister, tumbling over her as he catches something thrown from the woodline and she goes, "You clod, you oaf! The dance is tomorrow! The spring ritual is tomorrow." He catches it and says, "(panting) I won. I won."
segments.summary: Vaelus remembers dancing with her siblings Maywyn and Arthas in preparation for a spring ritual

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Your brother, you see he has golden and green skin that merges up into what would look like this bright red hair. Your sister is lavender and then bright spring yellow, but you see her face flushes with red as she looks at him and says, "Keep your game to the woods where it belongs!" You see a number of elven youths from the woodline go, "Sorry!" "Sorry!"
segments.summary: Description of Vaelus's siblings and other elven youths

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You see they say, "You want to come play with us?"

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley)
segments.content: Yes, I do!

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "Do you--"

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley)
segments.content: But I can't!

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Your brother looks down and says, "You could, you know. You know the dance well enough."

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley)
segments.content: Maywyn.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "Don't."

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley)
segments.content: Please. Just for a little bit.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: She looks at--

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley)
segments.content: I know all of the moves. I know everything I'm supposed to do. Please.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: She looks at you. "Three, two, one!" Grabs the ball from your brother and says, "Go! Go long!"

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley)
segments.content: Book it. Take off, bare feet. So used to running outside, stepping on rocks, light as air.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Where you run, you and your sister, leaving from this ceremony of Sylandri, your mother, the goddess of life, you wonder if your goddess would be cross at you for abandoning this ritual, but looking behind you in your footsteps, flowers bloom wherever your feet walk. You, at the end of play, sweat across your brow, you see these young elven youths, their hair and skin red and gold and violet and green and purple and every color, floral like a forest or a garden in bloom. You look out and see your mother smiling at you. As you collapse, she brings a silver platter of fruit. Off in the distance, you hear the voice of your father. She looks at you, your brother. "(panting) I'm so tired!" You see that she puts this food in front of you.
segments.summary: Vaelus runs with her sister, abandoning the ritual of Sylandri. Flowers bloom in her footsteps. Their mother brings them food.

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley)
segments.content: Oh, this looks delicious!

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "Ever ready, you need your energy for tomorrow, so eat up."

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley)
segments.content: I just pile in, a mess, taking in the food.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Juice running down your chin, she looks at you and says, touches her temples and you see her eyes go white for a moment. She smiles. "You're very young, but I should probably teach you how to remember."

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley)
segments.content: What will I need to remember for?

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: She says, "I, myself, am 600 years of age, and when a moment is perfect, I just like to remember it." Looking at her three children, she smiles. Her eyes go white again as she remembers this moment. With no sleep, it's so important to remember. And what I would like, Vaelus, how many times in your nightly trances have you tried to remember that moment?
segments.summary: Vaelus's mother explains the importance of remembering perfect moments, being 600 years old

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley)
segments.content: Every single night.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: In your trance, you know the threat. Over centuries, you can lose moments like that. Too many years. An arrow flying from a bow must be kept straight if its flight is to last for centuries. You can't forget who you are. And as you look across this small, humble room in this inn in the Dvalmar Pass, you see a shape across from you staring into the dark. Occtis. Everyone else has gone to bed.

segments.content: Perishables, like food?

segments.speaker: Kattigan Vale (Robbie Daymond)
segments.content: As soon as he mentions talking and sitting down and talking, Kattigan, who's already bored out of his fucking mind, is just in the other side of the thing and he just starts doing a morning stretching routine. Like work, waking up his body and sort of moving around and he just goes: Yeah, yeah, let's talk, let's talk.

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: Not to put it too simply, but what are we doing?

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: This is to serve as a bit of a recalibration for us, are things that are chasing us just in case we need to diverge at a moment's notice.

segments.speaker: Whitney
segments.content: All we know is what his family is doing and that we are with you all now and we appreciate you protecting us. We think that we could help, but also, we don't know who anybody is. We're looking for your brother?

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: I think already this is going to serve well. We are not protecting you, I am protecting him.

segments.speaker: Whitney
segments.content: Yeah. Oh.

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: Kattigan is on some other shit.

segments.speaker: Kattigan Vale (Robbie Daymond)
segments.content: I know next to nothing about what we're doing.

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: Do you know Kattigan?

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: Oh. Ah!

segments.speaker: Kattigan Vale (Robbie Daymond)
segments.content: (wheezes)

segments.speaker: Whitney
segments.content: He's got soft hands.

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: (gasps) Oh fuck.

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: (laughs)

segments.speaker: Whitney
segments.content: It was real.

segments.speaker: Kattigan Vale (Robbie Daymond)
segments.content: Why'd you reach out?!

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: No, no, no. It was in character.

segments.speaker: Kattigan Vale (Robbie Daymond)
segments.content: It was RP.

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: That was in character.

segments.speaker: Kattigan Vale (Robbie Daymond)
segments.content: The RP was so deep.

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: No, it wasn't. Are you okay?

segments.speaker: Kattigan Vale (Robbie Daymond)
segments.content: The RP was so deep. Why would you reach that hand out?

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: Why would you grab me so hard with your hand?

segments.speaker: Kattigan Vale (Robbie Daymond)
segments.content: Because I'm a man! I'm a real live man. I'm sorry about your finger. I love you so much.

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: Are you okay? Is it broken again?

segments.speaker: Kattigan Vale (Robbie Daymond)
segments.content: I'm not going to delicately--

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: It's broken worse. (laughter)

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: He has quite a firm grip.

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: He does. Kattigan served with me in Torn Banner, along with Cyd and Casimir, so we all have a knowledge of those that we seek.

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: And me. I was there, too.

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: Thimble was--

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: You were a soldier?

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: Yeah.

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: -- closer to Thjazi than any of us.

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: Oh. Well, you seem small for a soldier, but I haven't met many.

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: Hey, I have a new sword. I could show you what I can do.

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: Yes. She could.

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: Could you?

segments.speaker: Whitney
segments.content: I think don't. I think we should move on.

segments.speaker: Kattigan Vale (Robbie Daymond)
segments.content: I think the last time she said that she wanted to cut someones balls off. So maybe, you don't want that.

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: I can do it now. I can do it.

segments.speaker: Kattigan Vale (Robbie Daymond)
segments.content: I know, but don't.

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: Yeah, a demonstration of something, sure, yes.

segments.speaker: Whitney
segments.content: We're trying to find your brother.

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: Yes. So you have a little background about us because we're sharing information. There is a bit of heat on Wick here right now.

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: Thank you so much for getting me out of the city and to safety, yes.

segments.speaker: Whitney
segments.content: Yeah, we disobeyed, he disobeyed his family by going against the orders to execute Thjazi, as you know. And now, has done that for a second time with you. And we don't know what his family is going to do. I work for him. I'm under a contract. I would love-- By the way, a contract that if I don't fulfill, I get yanked back to The Pit and I don't want to do that.

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: The Pit?

segments.speaker: Whitney
segments.content: The Pit is where I come from. Stinks.

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: Oh.

segments.speaker: Whitney
segments.content: Would love to be actually out here with you guys. We don't know what your family is going to do once this little ruse that we have started up of us being out on the streets and punishing people. I don't know, I made up a lie and I--

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: I feel safe right now that we're here, I could stay here while you go off and--

segments.speaker: Kattigan Vale (Robbie Daymond)
segments.content: No, that's a good question. What's your stake in this? I understand why you know, you would do what you are doing, but why'd you betray your family?

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: Well--

segments.speaker: Kattigan Vale (Robbie Daymond)
segments.content: I mean, keep it brief.

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: Sure, sure, sure.

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: (laughs)

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: The TLDR is, they were sort of--

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: TLDR was an ancient elven wizard. (laughter)

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: I am TLDR!

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: TLDR, spelled just as it sounds.

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: He gave the shortest speeches than anyone. (laughter)

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: We're going to fight. Let's go! (laughter)

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: I don't know what my family's up to, but there seems to be some rot among the Halovars.

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: Yeah, you think?

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: Yes, and they were responsible for Thjazi's--

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: Yeah.

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: -- demise. But possibly working with this Casimir person or instructing him or in league with him. I don't know, but I'd like to find out where the rot, I guess how far the rot spreads in my family. The Candescent Creed, it's meant goodness and right for years, but I feel like maybe they're not the greatest of people and maybe they could be salvaged. Maybe they could be shown the wrongness of their ways and I could correct things and--

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: Maybe they'll all rot. Did you say the Halovars are working with the Tachonis?

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: Oh. Is that, are you-- You were Thjazi's friend? Person?

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: Yeah.

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: Are you just in this for revenge, then?

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: Yeah. I don't have anywhere else to go really, not since-- No, so-- Yeah, I'm in it for revenge.

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: What happens after you've achieved your revenge?

segments.speaker: Kattigan Vale (Robbie Daymond)
segments.content: Ah, you worry too much.

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: Why are we thinking that far ahead?

segments.speaker: Kattigan Vale (Robbie Daymond)
segments.content: After? We're not even to the first part yet.

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: I mean, revenge is fueled by darkness and shadow and--

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: Oh, is it?

segments.speaker: Kattigan Vale (Robbie Daymond)
segments.content: Super powerful, though. It can really send you straight to what you're looking for.

segments.speaker: Tyranny (Whitney Moore)
segments.content: Let's save the proselytizing 'til--

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: I'm just saying that--

segments.speaker: Tyranny (Whitney Moore)
segments.content: -- the correct audience. I think that you just said something really important, which is that you have nowhere else to go and we have that in common.

segments.speaker: Kattigan Vale (Robbie Daymond)
segments.content: Cool, cool. One thing that bothers me, though. Your brother, that part doesn't match up for me. You said he's mixed up in this somehow?

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: Cyd was part of the rescue plan.

segments.speaker: Kattigan Vale (Robbie Daymond)
segments.content: Yeah, but he fucked it up, right?

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: Well, according to what's-his-fuck at the Crows, Cyd found out, Cyd found out of Casimir's betrayal and--

segments.speaker: Kattigan Vale (Robbie Daymond)
segments.content: Yeah?

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: -- Casimir came after him.

segments.speaker: Kattigan Vale (Robbie Daymond)
segments.content: Oh, I missed some of the stuff earlier in the city. I wasn't quite picking up on everything.

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: Yeah.

segments.speaker: Kattigan Vale (Robbie Daymond)
segments.content: Okay.

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: You were drunk. So.

segments.speaker: Kattigan Vale (Robbie Daymond)
segments.content: If you put that fine a point on it.

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: Yeah, yeah.

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: But I think he also smelled, sniffed out that things were afoot and had to flee.

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: Yeah.

segments.speaker: Kattigan Vale (Robbie Daymond)
segments.content: So what do we do if we do find your brother?

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: We have one more on our team, and I think he would also be heavily invested in speaking with Casimir.

segments.speaker: Kattigan Vale (Robbie Daymond)
segments.content: Yeah. Fun.

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: Yeah.

segments.speaker: Kattigan Vale (Robbie Daymond)
segments.content: Anyway--

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: Shall we?

segments.speaker: Tyranny (Whitney Moore)
segments.content: Yeah, we trust you guys to lead the way. We'll do our best.

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: Are you a good, talented fighter?

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: I can--

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: I don't care. We can go.

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: I can fight evil with--

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: (laughs)

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: Hey, Ulbid!

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: Okay.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Ulbid comes downstairs, "Huh?"

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: Can I take Sir Stagothy?

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "Just, oh!" Give me a persuasion check. (chuckling)

segments.speaker: Kattigan Vale (Robbie Daymond)
segments.content: Give us all your shit!

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: Yeah. (laughter)

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You see, he says, "Sir Stagothy? Of course, of course." You see, he says, he says, "Sir Stagothy will accompany you on your noble quest as is fitting for a knight and a toy and a deer." You see he looks, smiling, and goes, "Stagothy, there are certain toys that I would be very unwilling to part with, but the truth is, Stagothy had fallen out of the rotation even sort of early on. So I think he may well appreciate a little bit of time in the sun. I got better at making wheels as time went on and so Stagothy, you know, was an early attempt. I love him, but I will miss him very much. That's a good deer."

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: (laughs)

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: Teor, can you put him in your bag?

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: Yes. In my bag. (laughter)

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Hell, yes.

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: Do you just carry everything in your armpits?

segments.speaker: Tyranny (Whitney Moore)
segments.content: He's got big pits.

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: Keep your business to yourself. (laughter)

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: With that, I think you guys have concluded your business. Ulbid wishes you a fond farewell and says, "Well, travel safely. I don't know what business brings you north and perhaps it's better if I don't. I am perhaps a little bit too open hearted to be involved in criminality as I am, but very few people come by here, other than druids and the odd smuggler. So if I see anything, I will not mention that you passed this way unless you would like me to. I'll keep--"

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: No.

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: up and he's no longer angry and he says: I understand what you are, but your actions are your actions. That's it. I'm going to keep on marching and Wulferic is going to go shooting back.
segments.summary: Travis continues describing Teor's reaction to the situation

segments.speaker: Whitney
segments.content: (exhales)
segments.summary: Tyranny exhales in relief

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: See? All better.
segments.summary: Thimble tries to reassure everyone

segments.speaker: Whitney
segments.content: I have a feeling it's going to be a lot worse.
segments.summary: Tyranny expresses concern about future consequences

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: What makes you say that? You said this was the first time.
segments.summary: Teor questions Tyranny about her concerns

segments.speaker: Whitney
segments.content: I mean--
segments.summary: Tyranny starts to respond

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: As we walk.
segments.summary: Thimble indicates they should continue moving while talking

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: Was it like being in a dream where you could see yourself, but you weren't in control of what was happening? I only asked because if it happens again, it's not just you and Wick that is in danger. You compromise all of us.
segments.summary: Teor probes deeper into Tyranny's experience and warns about group safety

segments.speaker: Whitney
segments.content: I don't want to put anybody in danger. What I know is that it was sort of a-- It was sort of like a feeling inside me that I would explode if I didn't take it, and I don't steal stuff. I'm not like, I haven't needed to steal stuff. I've been very much cozy and comfy. I don't need to do any of that, but I--
segments.summary: Tyranny explains her compulsive feeling and that stealing isn't typical for her

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: But stealing stuff is not inherently bad.
segments.summary: Thimble offers a moral perspective on theft

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: It is, actually.
segments.summary: Wicander disagrees with Thimble's moral stance

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: What I'm saying--
segments.summary: Thimble tries to clarify her position

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: It's wrong.
segments.summary: Wicander reinforces his moral stance

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: But don't take from someone who has nothing.
segments.summary: Thimble clarifies her moral position about selective theft

segments.speaker: Whitney
segments.content: I don't know. I'm sorry. I think that whatever came over me, this probably won't be the last time it happened and maybe we can give a signal, maybe I can just say like, "Aah."
segments.summary: Tyranny apologizes and suggests a warning signal for future episodes

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: That's a terrible signal.
segments.summary: Wicander criticizes the proposed signal

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: Yeah.
segments.summary: Thimble agrees the signal is bad

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: Let's just--
segments.summary: Wicander starts to suggest an alternative

segments.speaker: Whitney
segments.content: We'll workshop.
segments.summary: Tyranny suggests they'll work on finding a better signal

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: When I see go, "Aah," I'll make sure to stab you just to stop it.
segments.summary: Thimble jokingly threatens to stab Tyranny if she uses the signal

segments.speaker: Whitney
segments.content: Don't stab me. I mean, we got two big guys and a normal sized guy.
segments.summary: Tyranny objects to being stabbed and comments on the party's size

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: I think I'm pretty big.
segments.summary: Wicander defends his size

segments.speaker: Whitney
segments.content: I will be as honest as I can if something is happening like that.
segments.summary: Tyranny promises to be honest about future compulsive episodes

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: This is growth. This is excellent. You came clean about something and now it's being undone--
segments.summary: Wicander encourages Tyranny's honesty as personal growth

segments.speaker: Whitney
segments.content: Oh god, oh god.
segments.summary: Tyranny expresses distress

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: -- and everything's going to be fine.
segments.summary: Wicander finishes his reassuring statement

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: Your intent is heard. I think what will matter is what happens the next time you encounter this.
segments.summary: Teor acknowledges Tyranny's intent while warning about future tests

segments.speaker: Whitney
segments.content: Oh god, you're rubbing off on me.
segments.summary: Tyranny comments on being influenced by the group

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: I found that whenever you have--
segments.summary: Wicander starts to give advice

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: We're walking again, at this point.
segments.summary: Teor indicates they've resumed walking

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: An urge--
segments.summary: Wicander continues his advice about urges

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: The blade is cursed, do you think? This is just me talking. Do you think we just killed Ulbid?
segments.summary: Thimble wonders if the blade is cursed and if they've killed Ulbid

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: No.
segments.summary: Wicander dismisses the concern

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: What? The blade?
segments.summary: Teor questions which blade Thimble means

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: Do you think the blade is cursed now and Ulbid's going to die?
segments.summary: Thimble clarifies her concern about the blade being cursed

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: Wait the knife or the blade?
segments.summary: Teor seeks clarification about which weapon

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: The knife! The knife.
segments.summary: Thimble clarifies she means the knife

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: No-- Oh. Red tendrils and shit?
segments.summary: Teor recalls the red tendrils from the knife

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: Tyranny, when I find myself having a desire--
segments.summary: Wicander returns to giving Tyranny advice about desires

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: Don't give him ideas.
segments.summary: Teor warns against giving Wicander bad ideas

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: (laughs)
segments.summary: Thimble laughs

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: A want for something--
segments.summary: Wicander continues describing desires

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: He doesn't need my ideas.
segments.summary: Thimble agrees Wicander doesn't need encouraging

segments.speaker: Kattigan Vale (Robbie Daymond)
segments.content: No.
segments.summary: Kattigan agrees

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: -- I like to push it down. I like to sort of bury it, hide it deep again. That always works for me, so maybe try that next time.
segments.summary: Wicander gives advice about suppressing desires

segments.speaker: Whitney
segments.content: I know that's what you do.
segments.summary: Tyranny acknowledges knowing Wicander's approach

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: I'd love an insight check from Tyranny, and then I'd like our survival checks. You are no longer rolling with advantage.
segments.summary: DM calls for insight and survival checks, notes loss of advantage

segments.speaker: Kattigan Vale (Robbie Daymond)
segments.content: Yeah, yeah.
segments.summary: Kattigan acknowledges the loss of advantage

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: Oh.
segments.summary: Thimble reacts to losing advantage

segments.speaker: Kattigan Vale (Robbie Daymond)
segments.content: That is the sucky part.
segments.summary: Kattigan comments on losing the advantage

segments.speaker: Whitney
segments.content: Insight?
segments.summary: Tyranny confirms the insight check request

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Insight.
segments.summary: DM confirms insight check

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: Oh, because of the wolf!
segments.summary: Teor realizes they lost advantage because the wolf left

segments.speaker: Kattigan Vale (Robbie Daymond)
segments.content: Yeah.
segments.summary: Kattigan confirms Teor's realization

segments.speaker: Players
segments.content: Players examining their miniatures and discussing positioning
segments.summary: Players react to seeing their character miniatures for the first time

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You guys are approaching this direction. Give me your marching order right around here.
segments.summary: DM establishes party positioning on the battle map

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: As we unfold-- You see approaching, on that 20, you're the only person who's unsurprised. Everyone else is walking, and Thimble, pulling ahead, you see this plinth ahead of you. You recognize this as a Fae boundary stone.
segments.summary: Thimble spots a Fae boundary stone ahead while the party approaches

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: It's basically a Sylvan protection. There's a certain degree of writing on it. I don't know if you're proficient in arcana or if you would know offhand, even though this is Faerie not--
segments.summary: DM describes the boundary stone as having Sylvan writing

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: But I speak Sylvan.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)

segments.content: Seven, incredible. So as this pixie erupts out of the flower, she flies about 20 feet into the air and this glob of pollen and dust whips out and boom, hits right in between the two of you. You get a full breath of it, Wick, and go unconscious.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)

They all look like kind of Lost Boy little dragonfly wood chip soldiers.

As she flops into the tree, boom, and sort of tumbles to the ground. Hitting the ground, she suffers her first failed death saving throw.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: As you hit this pixie, you hear a voice go, 'Honeysuckle!' And walking out from the rocks, you've seen some delightful little fairies of the realm of Hallow. Coming out from under the rocks, you see a man who's got a normal-sized head on a body about the size of a doll, so like a human head on a body about that big.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: I will say the difficulty's moved down now where 15 will be the third player character in a row taking nonviolent action. So if 15, a 10 will continue the conversation, a 15 will stop combat, a 20 will actually get them to heed you in this moment.

The cruelties of young children and your mother kneeling down, Iris, who believed so deeply in the Creed, wiping the tears from your face and saying, "You don't have to meet darkness with darkness. segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "Hearth. "You're from Hearth "or the Golden Orchard or something."
segments.summary: Honeysuckle guesses Thimble's origin

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: That's right.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: (gasps) "A garden fairy."

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: Yeah.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "That's wonderful. "Well, none of you are allowed here."
segments.summary: Honeysuckle cheerfully announces they're not allowed in the glade

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Hawthorn says, "Honeysuckle, to me." She says, (gasps) "Mama!" She goes, "I'm not your mom." And she flies over.
segments.summary: Hawthorn calls Honeysuckle over, correcting her about their relationship

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: Oh no, I love Honeysuckle. Oh shit! Our party grows! Amazing.

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: And now we're six.

segments.speaker: Kattigan Vale (Robbie Daymond)
segments.content: You just Kamehameha'd her into nonexistence.

segments.speaker: Tyranny (Whitney Moore)
segments.content: Okay. I think you're going to figure out what it actually means to be a believer and I think that you are doing that and I think that you're doing a really good job, so let's go.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Anyone who would like to give me a nature check on the way past that Sylvan boundary stone.
segments.summary: DM asks for nature checks at the boundary stone

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Or if anyone speaks Sylvan, you can take a closer look at it.
segments.summary: DM offers alternate approach for Sylvan speakers

segments.speaker: Laura (Thimble)
segments.content: Oh, I speak Sylvan.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Okay, yeah.

segments.speaker: Laura (Thimble)
segments.content: Oh. I actually rolled really good.

segments.speaker: Travis (Teor)
segments.content: Where were these rolls earlier?

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: 23. Hell yeah, what did we get over here?

segments.speaker: Travis (Teor)
segments.content: Dirty 20.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: 23, you read these warning signs. It says "Warning" in Sylvan on it and you see that there is a collection of sigils that are attached to some kind of innate magic deeper into this glade, farther into the woods here. On a 23 nature, you also see that this stone probably has, it's carved from deep in the ground and likely has others nearby. You can almost sense their presence in that nature check throughout the wood. The message in Sylvan simply says, "All who would seek to stab at the heart of creation know that it is your heart you seek to destroy."
segments.summary: Thimble reads Sylvan warning on boundary stone, senses network of protective stones

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: And that seems to be the-- It seems to be that's like the, it's almost incantation of a spell. It's a warning, but it's written so poetically because it is also the words necessary of casting a protection spell and you realize as you pass by the stone that you actually feel an arcane boundary here, so not only is it a warning to people that can read, but there's also some kind of magic anchored to it as you push through it. It's effortless. Tyranny, even you're a little worried about is this thing going to (vocalizing) and you move through it fine.
segments.summary: The warning doubles as protection spell incantation, creating magical boundary

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: On that dirty 20, Teor, you get, your whiskers and your nostrils twitch for a second. That Divine Sense, which is not fully active right now, on that 20, you sense that these stones have been keyed to the undead and that they would not feel an ease of passage through this boundary stone.
segments.summary: Teor's divine sense detects stones are warded against undead

segments.speaker: Laura (Thimble)
segments.content: Great.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Moving through the glade, you see, you guys are sort of in the back. Who's in the lead with Hawthorn?
segments.summary: DM asks about marching order

segments.speaker: Laura (Thimble)
segments.content: Probably, yeah.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Yeah. You walk up, you see that Rainbloom turns to you and is walking very slowly and goes, "So, you are a pixie of the Golden Orchard."
segments.summary: Rainbloom recognizes Thimble as from the Golden Orchard

segments.speaker: Laura (Thimble)
segments.content: More or less, yeah.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "Marvelous. How fares the noble House of Royce? Do you tend still to the gardens there?"
segments.summary: Rainbloom asks about House of Royce and the gardens

segments.speaker: Laura (Thimble)
segments.content: No, I don't tend to the gardens there. I haven't for a long time, actually.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "My condolences."

segments.speaker: Laura (Thimble)
segments.content: Thanks.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "You have been lost as many of us have been."

segments.speaker: Laura (Thimble)
segments.content: Well, I wasn't for a long time, actually. I was living in the city.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "How dreadful."

segments.speaker: Laura (Thimble)
segments.content: Yeah.

segments.speaker: Laura (Thimble)
segments.content: But it was not so bad. It had some good stuff going on.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "Oh. That's lovely."

segments.speaker: Laura (Thimble)
segments.content: It is good to be back, though, amongst everything.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "Yes, it is very good. Where we are going, it is almost like a little piece of home."

segments.speaker: Laura (Thimble)
segments.content: I've never seen home.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "You were born in the Orchard."

segments.speaker: Laura (Thimble)
segments.content: Yeah, yeah.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "It-- Colors beyond counting." You see that his eyes go prismatic, just rippling iridescent pools of color. "Sunrises of every hue painted across the sky. Even the memory of it fills my stalk with joy. One day, perhaps, but for now, the glade is home."
segments.summary: Rainbloom describes the Golden Orchard with wonder

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: He moves these vines to the side and before you, a massive hawthorn tree that is in full blossom, small white flowers, red berries, black thorns, spreads out over a enormous, grassy, and mostly clover-filled, it's a bunch of small, humble little grass flowers throughout this glade. You see this crystalline mountain lake that deep in the waters there are fish of silver and gold swimming throughout with small little mer-nixies swimming with them, little fish tails and fins. You see a massive awakened tree looking out over the glade. There are pixies and sprites and satyrs, all of whom are gathered here, and for a moment, it is this explosion of color and happy voices seeing Hawthorn approach.
segments.summary: Description of the fae glade with hawthorn tree, crystal lake, and various fae creatures
segments.location: Fae glade with hawthorn tree and crystal lake

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You see, as Hawthorn moves, you notice a small intake of breath. Just from her seeing, you realize that that tree that dominates the edge of the glade and the edge of the lake and where they meet is her, that is her, that tree. As she moves through, you see that many of the fairies laugh and alight. You see the three little sprite boys that are with you. You see that Hawthorn turns to them and says, "Bix, Mak, Flip, let everyone know we're safe." You see them go, "You got it!" Tear off.
segments.summary: Hawthorn's tree form is revealed, she sends the sprite boys to announce their safety

segments.speaker: Laura (Thimble)
segments.content: How are they so young still?

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "The three of them?"

segments.speaker: Laura (Thimble)
segments.content: Born here?

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "Born here."

segments.speaker: Laura (Thimble)
segments.content: Wow.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "Their mother came seeking out. Well, let me show you."

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: She takes you to the tree. It looks like a lot of people are gathered there. As you begin to walk through this place, you see that for all of its wonder and magic, there's a lot of indication here of how people have come to be here. You see that there are wagons with some broken wheels or otherwise unattended to off in a corner. You see there's a small area of meadow grass where some fairies are laid out with little flower bells casting light on them as they breathe shallowly. Some of them you see appear to have soot caked up around their neck or mouths as though they have been living somewhere too far away from anything of fae magic for too long.
segments.summary: Signs that the glade is a refugee settlement - broken wagons and injured fae suffering from lack of magic

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: In other words, there is a tremendous amount of play and whimsy here, but you also see by the trappings of how everyone has arrived here, that almost everyone here made it in the nick of time. Hawthorn turns and says, "Do any of you require rest or provisions?"
segments.summary: The glade is beautiful but clearly a refuge for fae who barely escaped something

segments.speaker: Tyranny (Whitney Moore)
segments.content: Sir, our Radiance is quite hungry. He did not eat today, and as you can tell, he is quite weak after a big show.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "Yes, well, with the power you wield, we must keep you healthy." She looks around and says, "Who's not-- Rustblossom."
segments.summary: Hawthorn calls for Rustblossom to help

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You see that a really small, flat clod of dirt with some of the ugliest red grass growing out of his flat little head. He's like a little plate of a fairy, no wings, just a little stumping guy. He says, "My lady." She says, "Please fetch some food for our guests." Rustblossom goes, "At your service. Strawberries."
segments.summary: Rustblossom described as earth fairy, tasked with getting food

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: Yes, yes, of course.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: bling mound comes and sits next to you, slightly beside Wick and gestures its featureless torso in your direction.
segments.summary: Shuffa sits next to Tyranny

segments.speaker: Tyranny (Whitney Moore)
segments.content: Tyranny is surrounded by a lot of good, and she extends her hand and places it approximates where an ear would be and scratches the sides.
segments.summary: Tyranny pets Shuffa

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Shuffa, you realize, earns his name as he goes, (whooshing) and a bunch of leaves fall out and leans against you in a conspiratorial way where it seems to be that the shambling mound is like, "We both work for the big guy."
segments.summary: Shuffa acts conspiratorially with Tyranny about serving their common master

segments.speaker: Tyranny (Whitney Moore)
segments.content: Oh!
segments.summary: Tyranny reacts to Shuffa's conspiratorial behavior

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Kattigan, as you walk away, Wulferic comes up to your side with his armor and you see paws at his armor where it harnesses to his shoulder. And you see that there's a small rolled-up scroll there.
segments.summary: Wulferic brings Kattigan a scroll

segments.speaker: Kattigan (Robbie)
segments.content: Yeah, I take a look at it, put my head up against Wulferic and look at the scroll. And I unwind it and read it.
segments.summary: Kattigan reads the scroll

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: A small note quickly penned from Ulbid says, "I cannot express how meaningful it is to have this knife returned nor can I express how many hidden treasures I discovered turning my house upside down in search of it."
segments.summary: Brennan reads Ulbid's note about receiving the knife handle back

segments.speaker: Kattigan (Robbie)
segments.content: Yeah, the response makes Kattigan smile just a little bit, because all the note said that he attached to it was, "It's not just a keepsake, it's a relic." And what he received wrapped up in the note was just the finely ornate, crafted pommel, the handle of the knife, the important part. And the full tang of the blade is in my pocket.
segments.summary: Kattigan reveals he kept the blade and only returned the handle

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You see the note continues. Having revealed that you have separated this magical blade from its ornate and beautiful handle, the note continues. "Memory is a funny thing. I wept at the thought that I had lost something so dear and in weeping, realized I had walked too far from those memories. The things I felt are dear to me even when they hurt. I don't know what use the blade has for you, but my wife used it for many years to feed and care for us. I hope that you find it useful to feed and care for those near you. And I hope, dear friend, that you are fed and cared for. You are welcome to bathe in my stream at the drop of a hat at any time."
segments.summary: The note continues with Ulbid's heartfelt message about memory and the blade's purpose

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Looking at the blade in your hand, I think you even feel a resonance. That humble little magic. You don't describe your magic as being too advanced. Something in that blade, little serrated thing, sharp and like Tyranny's claws, there's something there.
segments.summary: Kattigan feels magical resonance with the blade

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Moving into the cave, you see Soobri, who you can't even really tell what kind of fairy she is, but you see that she looks over and as Hawthorn says, "You're certain? Is it possible that he would've ignored your--" and you see Soobri, he says, "Well, anything is possible. But I did what we thought was right to do. I did what you had thought was right to do."
segments.summary: Hawthorn and Soobri discuss a decision they made

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Hawthorn stands up a little bit and gets a little bit intense and goes, "I made the advisement that we do this and it was accepted by those here." Soobri says, "Then, do you wish to tell the companions?" And I think that she turns around and sees you approaching now and goes, "Oh--"
segments.summary: Hawthorn and Soobri notice the party approaching as they discuss telling them something

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: Tell us what?
segments.summary: Thimble asks what they need to be told

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "(sighs) Your friend's brother has left already, heading north. But the magic that your companion wields is powerful and it is a great aid to us here."
segments.summary: Hawthorn reveals Cyd has left and mentions someone's powerful magic

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Another voice speaks out from not too far away emerging from the shadows and you turn and see shadows part like wet hair being moved from in front of an eye and stepping from the shadows, bulbous, luminous eye like a predator.
segments.summary: A mysterious figure emerges from the shadows

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: I fly backwards a little bit.
segments.summary: Thimble retreats from the emerging figure

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: A woman dressed in rags looking blue-gray, like a long-dead corpse, wet skin. You see there's mud and algae and reeds sewn throughout her hair. You can tell that if she walked into the water, her hair would spread out and look like lilies. She's got long fingers for grabbing onto people's throats. And then she steps out, she says, "Your friend's left, but a source of light, has entered the camp, hasn't it?"
segments.summary: Description of Sallow, a hag-like creature who mentions a source of light

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Hawthorn turns to face this and says, "This is Sallow." You see that you regard a hag.
segments.summary: Hawthorn introduces Sallow as a hag

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: I was going to ask.
segments.summary: Travis comments on identifying the hag

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You regard a hag before you.
segments.summary: Confirmation that Sallow is a hag

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: Oh man. Oh man.
segments.summary: Travis reacts to the hag revelation

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Sallow says, "Splendid light. I would love to be introduced to this wielder of the light. You don't think he might profess some beneficent cause or creed perhaps?"
segments.summary: Sallow expresses interest in meeting the light wielder

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: Why do you ask?
segments.summary: Thimble questions Sallow's interest

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "Well, it's always of interest, isn't it? Mortal magic wielders after all can sometimes spell disaster for the fair folk."
segments.summary: Sallow explains her concern about mortal magic wielders

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: I look over at Hawthorn. How is she reacting to this?
segments.summary: Thimble checks Hawthorn's reaction

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Hawthorn stands there. Give me an insight check. You can do so with the advantage here.
segments.summary: Brennan calls for an insight check with advantage

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: It's all fun and games 'til a fucking hag--
segments.summary: Travis comments on the situation turning serious

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: Oh, that was almost a nat 20. Almost. That is a 24.
segments.summary: Thimble rolls a 24 on insight

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: 24 is very high. You see the-- You almost thought: Oh, maybe Rainbloom, maybe the big mushroom guy is second in command. You realize he's a majordomo. He's an assistant to Hawthorn. What's happening at camp is it's Hawthorn's tree. There's Soobri, who seems to be uncomfortable with something that Hawthorn said or did. And then on the other side of Soobri is Sallow.
segments.summary: Thimble realizes the camp's power structure with Hawthorn at the center, flanked by Soobri and Sallow

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: Angel and the demon.
segments.summary: Thimble characterizes Soobri and Sallow

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Yes, you just see a relationship pan out before you of Hawthorn being pulled in different directions.
segments.summary: Brennan confirms Hawthorn is being pulled between different advisors

segments.speaker: Tyranny (Whitney Moore)
segments.content: Not an angel and a demon.
segments.summary: Tyranny corrects the characterization

segments.speaker: Tyranny (Whitney Moore)
segments.content: I'm right here. (laughs)
segments.summary: Tyranny jokes about being the demon

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: A buddy and a baddie.
segments.summary: Thimble rephrases her characterization

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Hawthorn says, "(sighs) I am not certain. Your business is your own. You are safe here. Your friends are welcome, but they cannot stay, and they must be sworn to some degree of secrecy or permit themselves. We have means of confusing their direction on their exit from the forest so that they would not easily find their way back here. If they will submit to that, then they are free to go."
segments.summary: Hawthorn explains the conditions for the party's safety and departure

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: I think some of them might, but if that's what must happen, we should be out of here soon. We're looking for Cyd, The lion folk, you said, passed through here?
segments.summary: Thimble accepts the conditions and asks about Cyd

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Hawthorn looks up. On that 24, something bad is being concealed from you. You see Soobri's eyes look down.
segments.summary: Thimble senses something bad is being hidden, Soobri looks guilty

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: What happened? I float a little closer. What happened to him?
segments.summary: Thimble presses for information about what happened to Cyd

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "He left." You see Soobri looks out. Sallow smiles and you see that, as she smiles, even though she can kind of look from a distance like a mortal woman, the corner of her mouth goes almost to her ear when she smiles. "We sent him to the wraith tree."
segments.summary: Hawthorn claims Cyd left, but Sallow reveals they sent him to the wraith tree

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: The what?
segments.summary: Thimble reacts with alarm to mention of wraith tree

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "Soobri here is a bit of a soothsayer. A fortune teller, aren't you, Soobri? Her fortunes aren't real. They don't come true." You see that Soobri, her eyes well up with tears. She says, "Sometimes they do," and you see Sallow goes, "It was Hawthorn's decision that any big folk that came through rather than subjecting our people to wanton violence and execution. Why invite all that bloodshed and we could send them to the tree and have a little bit of extra protection."
segments.summary: Sallow reveals Soobri is a fortune teller and explains their decision to send big folk to the wraith tree for protection

segments.speaker: Kattigan (Robbie)
segments.content: Oh fuck, when?
segments.summary: Kattigan reacts with alarm (though not present in scene)

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: But you're not here. (laughs)
segments.summary: Laura reminds Robbie his character isn't in the scene

segments.speaker: Soobri
segments.content: He asked for visions of what was to come. He was seeking to make his way to a place known as Gormalay, where he had there a deed of title to a strong home. And he had told us his plan was to petition the lord of that place, that the deed had been given in an act of murder and should not be honored. He said also that he was searching for passage to the far east, to old Obridimia searching for his brother.
segments.summary: Soobri explains Cyd's goals and plans

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: I'm with his brother.
segments.summary: Thimble reveals she's traveling with Cyd's brother

segments.speaker: Soobri
segments.content: He will not have known that. He will not have known that his brother was-- I know that the warrior who accompanies you outside is the brother of the one that we found here. He believes him to be far east, he said, working as a mercenary.
segments.summary: Soobri explains that Cyd doesn't know his brother is nearby

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: Well-- Where's the wraith tree?
segments.summary: Thimble asks about the wraith tree location

segments.speaker: Sir Julien Davinos (Matthew Mercer)
segments.content: I gave-- You should go and talk to Sallow. I should say no more. But I--
segments.summary: Julien suggests they talk to Sallow about the wraith tree

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: Yeah, do it.
segments.summary: Teor encourages them to proceed

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: I gave a vision. You see her eyes wink. You see that she reaches her hands up, and as she does, she massages her scalp and slightly moves her bandana. And you can see the broken stumps of a faun's horns as she massages them. And you can see the burn marks of red hot iron, that this soothsayer has suffered in the world of mortals greatly.
segments.summary: Soobri reveals her broken faun horns and burn scars

segments.speaker: Soobri
segments.content: I did see something in the crystal. No matter what Sallow says, I do see things true sometimes. I thought I saw the young man past the edge of the forest. I do not know if it was a vision of the past or of things to come, but I saw him in the forest holding the scroll that he had come here with, that he had shown to me. He was either in possession of it some time ago, or perhaps I saw a vision of something to come. But he looked out at wide fields and rolling hills, old stone walls of the kinds that farmers keep in their old ways. And I saw a fluttering of crow's wings and him clapped in irons. Wagon wheels on a road.
segments.summary: Soobri shares her vision of Cyd in chains with crows

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: Oh no.
segments.summary: Thimble reacts with concern to the vision

segments.speaker: Soobri
segments.content: I do get them right sometimes.
segments.summary: Soobri defends the accuracy of her visions

segments.speaker: Kattigan Vale (Robbie)
segments.content: I know I messed this up. I'm sorry. But listen to me right now, please. There are a few things I'm good for. You have to find out when he came through here. You have to stay on track. This is a hunt.
segments.summary: Kattigan apologizes and urges them to focus on tracking Cyd

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: Yeah. Was it yesterday?
segments.summary: Thimble asks about the timing

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: It was, no. Now two days ago. Which you guys realize because you guys went to Ulbid's and played it safe.
segments.summary: The DM clarifies that Cyd came through two days ago

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: Right. And he went straight--
segments.summary: Thimble processes the timeline

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Cyd did not play it safe.
segments.summary: The DM notes that Cyd took risks unlike the party

segments.speaker: Kattigan Vale (Robbie)
segments.content: Do I hear them say this, that it was two days ago?
segments.summary: Kattigan confirms he heard the timeline

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Yeah, Soobri says two days ago.
segments.summary: Confirmation that Soobri said two days ago

segments.speaker: Kattigan Vale (Robbie)
segments.content: We have to go.
segments.summary: Kattigan urges immediate departure

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: What about Sallow?
segments.summary: Thimble asks about visiting Sallow

segments.speaker: Kattigan Vale (Robbie)
segments.content: You can go, but it needs to be fast, please. For Teor.
segments.summary: Kattigan allows the Sallow visit but emphasizes speed

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: She'll tell me where it is?
segments.summary: Thimble confirms Sallow will provide location

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Soobri nods.
segments.summary: Soobri confirms with a nod

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: Where's Sallow?
segments.summary: Thimble asks for Sallow's location

segments.speaker: Soobri
segments.content: By the water's edge.
segments.summary: Soobri directs them to Sallow by the water

segments.speaker: Kattigan Vale (Robbie)
segments.content: Go. Go.
segments.summary: Kattigan urges Thimble to hurry

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: (balks) I don't like that thing.
segments.summary: Thimble expresses reluctance about Sallow

segments.speaker: Kattigan Vale (Robbie)
segments.content: (laughs)

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Outside, those of you who have not joined, you see Teor sitting out. What are you guys up to as this scene is unfolding?

segments.speaker: Wicander (Sam)
segments.content: We're playing fetch with Shuffa. I just threw my cane.
segments.summary: Wicander plays fetch with his familiar

segments.speaker: Wicander (Sam)
segments.content: Go get it. Go get it!

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: I have a question for you. Do you have any visible signs of the Candescent Creed still on your person?
segments.summary: DM asks about Candescent Creed symbols

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: Uh-oh. Just all your clothes?
segments.summary: Thimble realizes the implications

segments.speaker: Tyranny (Whitney Moore)
segments.content: Yeah, everything.
segments.summary: Tyranny confirms Wicander's religious attire

segments.speaker: Wicander (Sam)
segments.content: Everything I own.
segments.summary: Wicander confirms all his possessions bear religious symbols

segments.speaker: Wicander (Sam)
segments.content: My cane has a big Candescent Creed symbol on it.
segments.summary: Wicander specifically mentions his cane's religious symbol

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: As you're playing fetch with Shuffa, going back and forth, you see a bunch of these tiny little fairy children whose wings are too small to fly yet, and they have these little toadstool hats on, running around towards your feet. You see that about a foot tall is this, he's got a small rapier at his side, grasshopper legs and antenna, but otherwise a handsome man's face. He's got a small white shirt and a vest, and a scroll on his back. He looks over as he's walking off towards one of the-- You see there's a cart that looks like a traveling scholar's cart. You see it has some writing on the side saying, "Traveling professor." He looks over and goes, "Children, back away from him. Back away from him."
segments.summary: A fairy scholar notices Wicander and warns fairy children away

segments.speaker: Wicander (Sam)
segments.content: Oh, I'm sorry. Did I do something wrong?
segments.summary: Wicander apologizes and asks what he did wrong

segments.speaker: Traveling Professor Fairy
segments.content: You bear a symbol that is not welcome here.

segments.speaker: Wicander (Sam)
segments.content: Oh, I'm sorry. I didn't know. Why? Why, may I ask?
segments.summary: Wicander apologizes and asks for explanation

segments.speaker: Traveling Professor Fairy
segments.content: Why, indeed. And what have you told the people in the keeping of their old ways? Have you told them that it is not of the light to leave bread and milk for the small folk, to take down charms?
segments.summary: The fairy accuses Candescent Creed followers of suppressing old traditions

segments.speaker: Wicander (Sam)
segments.content: No, I haven't told them that at all. Is that, is that something--
segments.summary: Wicander denies telling people to abandon old ways

segments.speaker: Traveling Professor Fairy
segments.content: Is that so? And you say that here, surrounded by strawberries, freshly grown. Well, you might be--
segments.summary: The fairy questions Wicander while noting the fresh strawberries

segments.speaker: Tyranny (Whitney Moore)
segments.content: Hey man, he's the one who grew the strawberries. Why don't you just look around and see all the beautiful abundance? That was, he did that.
segments.summary: Tyranny defends Wicander by pointing out he grew the strawberries

segments.speaker: Wicander (Sam)
segments.content: I wipe my face of all the strawberry juice.
segments.summary: Wicander cleans strawberry juice from his face

segments.speaker: Tyranny (Whitney Moore)
segments.content: He did that. You see we have friends here, right?
segments.summary: Tyranny continues defending Wicander and appeals to their friendship

segments.speaker: Traveling Professor Fairy
segments.content: Yes, well, the light giveth. Yes.
segments.summary: The fairy grudgingly acknowledges the good deed

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "Well, he seemed... Well, he wasn't in a good way. I mean, he didn't get a warm welcome here, but they were going to give him a vision. He's off looking for-- He needed to make his way, he was trying to talk to--"
segments.summary: The bowka continues describing Cyd's state and purpose

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: ♪ Make his way ♪
segments.summary: Laura sings a brief melody during the NPC's dialogue

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "-- some baron. He was trying to talk to some local baron, but he had-- After that, I spoke with him because we had a mutual friend that came up in conversation as he was-- Few people would go and talk to him. But we had a mutual friend in common that I'm actually on my way to go see that he said might be dead by this point in time. Although, I hope--"
segments.summary: Jauf explains Cyd's mission and mentions a mutual friend

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: Did he mention Thjazi?
segments.summary: Teor asks if Cyd mentioned Thjazi

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "That's who I'm off to see. Is he..."

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: I'm afraid so.
segments.summary: Teor confirms Thjazi's death

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "Cyd said it was all but a sure thing. Apparently, he was part of a plan to try and free him at the last moment."

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: He was a great man. I served with him for many years. How did you know him?
segments.summary: Teor pays respects to Thjazi and asks about Jauf's connection

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "I knew of him, more or less, through a connection at a place called The Archanade. It's a museum in Dol-Makjar."

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: Mm.

segments.speaker: Kattigan Vale (Robbie Daymond)
segments.content: Oh, yeah, yeah. We've been there.
segments.summary: Robbie recognizes The Archanade

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: (gasps)
segments.summary: Laura gasps in recognition

segments.speaker: Tyranny (Whitney Moore)
segments.content: Oh, ho, ho.

segments.speaker: Kattigan Vale (Robbie Daymond)
segments.content: Oh, whoa, whoa.
segments.summary: Robbie realizes the significance

segments.speaker: Sam Riegel (Wicander)
segments.content: Wait, that's Taliesin's place.
segments.summary: Sam identifies The Archanade as Bolaire's location

segments.speaker: Kattigan Vale (Robbie Daymond)
segments.content: Wait a second now.
segments.summary: Robbie processes the connection

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: Yeah, we-- Oh.
segments.summary: Laura realizes the connection to their party member

segments.speaker: Kattigan Vale (Robbie Daymond)
segments.content: Okay.
segments.summary: Robbie acknowledges the revelation

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: He says, "But I was coming with a letter for him because I know that Thjazi worked with Thimble who, I don't know if she'd remember me, but I knew that she knew half the fairies in Dol-Makjar, and I think we've spoken once or twice if that, but she was working with Thjazi on collecting a number of things, and Thjazi had sent a letter off to a fellow I knew in Argosia about--" He says, "Are you a friend of Thimble's?"
segments.summary: Jauf reveals he has a letter and knows of Thimble's work with Thjazi

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: I am.
segments.summary: Teor confirms he is Thimble's friend

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "Well, I'm Jauf. Nice to meet you."
segments.summary: The bowka introduces himself as Jauf

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: Jauf, Teor.
segments.summary: Teor introduces himself to Jauf

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "Teor, nice to meet you."
segments.summary: Jauf acknowledges Teor's introduction

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You would recognize him as a bowka, which is a type of fairy that has a single animal form it can assume and change into.
segments.summary: Brennan describes Jauf's fairy type

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: And he says, "Bad luck to carry a dead man's letter. Not to give you bad luck, but for Thimble, it'll maybe mean something."
segments.summary: Jauf explains about carrying Thjazi's letter

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: And he just gives you a small envelope that he was delivering to The Archanade.
segments.summary: Jauf gives Teor the letter intended for The Archanade

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Says, "For better or worse, I think it was, Thjazi liked to keep his distance from the people so that if what were to happen were to happen, fewer people all go down at once."
segments.summary: Jauf explains Thjazi's cautious approach to relationships

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: Very careful of him. I'll be back in just a moment.
segments.summary: Teor acknowledges Thjazi's wisdom and excuses himself

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "It's all right, I'll be resting up and, yeah, if you let them know that I'm here."
segments.summary: Jauf agrees to wait while Teor handles other business

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You take off. You guys head to the lake.

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: Us two?
segments.summary: Laura confirms who is going to the lake

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Yeah, Kattigan and--

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: Kattigan's still like this.
segments.summary: Travis reminds everyone of Kattigan's charmed state

segments.speaker: Kattigan Vale (Robbie Daymond)
segments.content: The best partner you could ask for.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Arriving at the lake, you see algae.

segments.content: It looks like sunset.

segments.content: Ooh.

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: There she is.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Tall woman stands up.
segments.summary: Sallow fully emerges from the water

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "Hello, little one. A man, so loud."

segments.speaker: Kattigan Vale (Robbie Daymond)
segments.content: You better believe it.

segments.content: "You look dirty with travel. Do you want to bathe?"

segments.content: No, I like to be dirty.

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: (laughs) Jeez.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Give me persuasion.

segments.content: Maybe Thimble should--

segments.content: You get Light, and what Light does, is it makes the area right around you safe and everything else fucking vanishes, pure dark.

segments.speaker: Travis (Teor)
segments.content: Nice job. Very good, thank you.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: So, you guys continue forward into the dark. Wraith tree, some spirit that was mentioned here and you realize that the early conversation you heard between Soobri and Hawthorn, why would they send people here? They didn't want to kill them there. And someone said something about another protector, and you suddenly hear moans in the forest.
