segments.speaker: Laura (Thimble)
segments.content: Oh.

segments.speaker: Tyranny (Whitney Moore)
segments.content: (moans)

segments.speaker: Robbie (Kattigan)
segments.content: Not that kind of moan.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You see a camp counselor put on a flashlight and go, "Nuh-uh! Nuh-uh, no way." From deep memory-- Walking behind the bunks going, "Whoop, whoop!" "All right, fucking scatter."
segments.summary: Brennan makes a camp counselor joke about the situation

segments.speaker: Robbie (Kattigan)
segments.content: As we're absolutely trucking through the woods and we all sense this moan as we're running just nonchalant, Kattigan says: Whatever you think is out there, it's worse. Keep moving.

segments.speaker: Sam (Wicander)
segments.content: Point of clarification. Back at Hawthorn's Glade, did we take a short rest?

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You took a short rest at Hawthorn's Glade. Everybody short rest your characters. If you want to roll, yeah, if you have hit dice you want to roll, yeah. Hell, yeah.
segments.summary: The party retroactively takes a short rest

segments.speaker: Laura (Thimble)
segments.content: As we were going through the forest, did I have-- Never mind, it's too late. I was going to say, did I spot any foxglove or prickly poppy as we had been going through the forest before we got, in any of our treks today?

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: I think very possibly so, yeah. I think there will be plenty more as well. Yes, for sure.
segments.summary: Brennan confirms Thimble would have spotted useful herbs during their travels

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You guys had had your short rest, surged through. On that 16, you continue moving and have that thought in your head, sending people to the wraith tree. As you hear the shuffling and groans, you realize perhaps whatever's waiting here takes whatever bodies it creates and adds them to the force that will visit the next victim here. Maybe you'll be joining that wonderful army right now. Roll initiative.
segments.summary: Combat begins as the party realizes they may become part of an undead army

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: As you guys enter, you see deep in the forest, a writhing mass of dead vines. There is something here that killed this tree and I think, Thimble, you look up and realize that the tree that is dead here once walked the forest. You are looking at the corpse of an awakened tree, and the one who killed it appears in shadow.
segments.summary: The party discovers a dead awakened tree and sees a shadowy figure that killed it

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: The figure floating in the glade. Floating by the tree. It looks up, looks right at you, Thimble. (whispers) "You should not have come." Raises a hand and shapes begin to emerge from the woodline all around you.
segments.summary: A floating wraith addresses Thimble directly and summons creatures from the forest

segments.speaker: Various
segments.content: Initiative rolls and positioning discussion
segments.summary: Players roll initiative and discuss positioning

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: In that area of dim light, you see some shapes clambering towards you. These are the closest. You see corporeal undead, but you see they look to be-- The rags on them seem to indicate that they were poachers or smugglers in life, but at a flick of the hooded figure's hand, they animate around you. The wounds that they bear, many of them, you can see are the wounds that they are soon to deliver to you, for indeed, many of these bodies look like they were rent asunder by human hands, jaws pulled by hand, by bodies. Stomachs pulled open.
segments.summary: Undead creatures that were once poachers or smugglers emerge, animated by the wraith

segments.speaker: Laura (Thimble)
segments.content: I am going to fly up in the air so I'm out of range, hopefully, of most of these zippity zombies, and I'm going to cast-- I'm going to light up with the light of the moon stone that I had been near and the radiant magic that had been filling me when I was in that cave, and that pale blue, whitish glow of the crystal is going to spread from my wings as I spin around and I'm going to cast Faerie Fire.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: The Faerie Fire you cast forward hits towards there and vanishes into the darkness of the wraith, just (whoosh) It does not light anything on the ground surrounding within like 10 feet of that wraith is not there. However, you do manage to hit two zombies farther away from him who fail their save and therefore you get the advantage on them.
segments.summary: Thimble's Faerie Fire spell is partially absorbed by the wraith but affects two zombies

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: He is out of range of the 20 foot radius. If you were centering on the wraith, it would've been--

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: I was centering it, I wasn't centering it on the wraith.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Gotcha, gotcha. Okay, in that case, let me roll for him as well. You got him as well.

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam)
segments.content: And we can all see those creatures now, right?

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: You can see they're lit up. They emit a dim light now so you can see them within 10 feet. And you get advantage on attacks against them.

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam)
segments.content: Fellow practitioner of the Light, I see.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Kattigan, you're on deck, by the way. Thimble, great, any bonus actions from you or anything else?

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: I don't think I can do anything else. Oh, but I'm going to hide. I'm going to shimmy into the leaves of that tree next to me.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: -- give me a stealth check.

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: Okay. So aggressively. 18. No wait, that's a lie, that's 16 plus nine. (laughs) 25, that's way better!

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: So you see that as these undead lurch towards you here by this rotting, necrotic tree that the zombies lurch forward and you've seen, effectively, you take all of the glow on you and put it out there because you are fucking gone. It's just, all this moonlight and crystal magic shoots off you, hits these three zombies that are marching towards you and you are in the branches of that tree completely obfuscated, all of your internal glow is dimmed. You're a shadow. Incredible.
segments.summary: Thimble successfully hides in the tree after casting Faerie Fire on the zombies

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Kattigan, that is you.

segments.speaker: Kattigan Vale (Robbie)
segments.content: Great. The top of the turn, Wulferic knows exactly what to do, so he rips around straight to Kattigan's side, like a well-trained canine right between his legs and Kattigan just goes: Now's the time. And they put their, they go forehead to forehead. It's really quick and you can just feel this energy between them and that empty quiver that has been on Wulferic's side the whole time starts to glow faintly and Kattigan's weapon starts to glow faintly, and in that quiver, this single bolt of white energy appears and there is one bolt, magical bolt, inside of this quiver, and then they push together as quickly as they can and another red one starts to form, but it just doesn't happen, it just fucking fizzles out and there's just the one magical bolt inside the quiver and they break away and Kattigan just goes, 'Good boy.' And Wulferic takes off into the woods
segments.summary: Kattigan and Wulferic perform a magical bonding ritual that creates one magical bolt

segments.speaker: Kattigan Vale (Robbie)
segments.content: He's going to look like he's going to close the gap to pull out his club and melee, and instead as he's running toward it, out of his back, he pulls just a regular wooden bolt. And for the first time ever, you see what this weapon is. It's not just a club, it's not just a blade, it's an atlatl handle, and carved into the notch of the wood is an atlatl handle, and he tucks it at the same time, hurls this thing as hard as he can at the nearest zombie. Regular melee attack, nothing magic about it.
segments.summary: Kattigan reveals his weapon is an atlatl and attacks a zombie

segments.speaker: Kattigan Vale (Robbie)
segments.content: Pretty decent. 17 plus... Seven plus four, 11 points of piercing damage.
segments.summary: Kattigan hits for 11 piercing damage

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Hell, yes. You surge forward, you're back. As you've approached north and Timmony, this is not your first time facing the dead in the dark forest. This bolt lodges itself and you can see, even with their undead animation, muscle is still muscle, sinew is still sinew, and you pin deep into the thigh, right in between where the groin meets the leg, shredding muscle and sinew. This thing hobbles to one side, still up, but lurching badly. You have bloodied this thing in a single hit.
segments.summary: Kattigan's attack severely wounds the zombie

segments.speaker: Kattigan Vale (Robbie)
segments.content: But I'll say this for you and for the nerds since this is a cooked-up weapon that we worked on, it is reduced range from a bow. So it's not, I think it's 30-60 for a bow, is that right? This weapon, because of its versatility, is a little nerfed in range, so it's 20-40. So I've got to get within 20 feet to make the dart throw. And that ends my turn.
segments.summary: Kattigan explains his weapon mechanics

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Hell yeah. Wick, that is you, my friend.

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam)
segments.content: I am a cleric of the Light and as a cleric, I will activate my Innate Sorcery. My eyes glow, just overcome with the pressure and danger of the moment. I look at Tyranny, unsure of what I'm doing. I've never really been in a fight like this.
segments.summary: Wick activates his magical abilities

segments.speaker: Tyranny (Whitney Moore)
segments.content: Ah, your eyes are glowing!

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam)
segments.content: They are? Oh my goodness. My eyes start glowing white and I will charge forward trying to make her proud of me and I will bound forward and try to get these two glowy guys here in a cone in front of me. I disagree! And from my cane that's emitting light, the light will increase and bubble out into a prismatic-- Other colors that will dance around in front of me and I will cast Color Spray on these two and attempt to blind them.
segments.summary: Wick casts Color Spray on two zombies

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: What is the save that they make for Color Spray? Constitution 15. Let's go. The one at the far end is almost outside enough that it makes the save but the one right in front of you gets the full dose of it. Until the end of your next turn.
segments.summary: One zombie is blinded by Color Spray

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Hell yes. You see this one fucking zombie in front of you has Faerie Fire and Color Spray. This is the most Technicolor Dream Zombie. Just (buzzing). And is now fully blinded. Incredible.
segments.summary: The zombie is affected by both Faerie Fire and Color Spray

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You hear '(raspy moan), The sun will never rise again.'
segments.summary: The wraith speaks ominously

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam)
segments.content: What? What was that? Did everyone hear that? Hello?

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Oh god, this guy's so fast. That's not good. Wraith-- Is going to-- -- descend right here and is going to attack-- -- Wick directly.
segments.summary: The wraith attacks Wicander

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam)
segments.content: Don't worry, they can't see me. I've blinded them all. Just one.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: I need more dice, sorry. I need more.
segments.summary: DM prepares for damage calculation

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: I should have cast something protective on him before we started.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Wick, you take-- Yes, and I hit. I rolled, does a 14 hit?
segments.summary: The wraith's attack roll

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam)
segments.content: Oh. It would if I didn't cast Shield and block it.
segments.summary: Wick casts Shield to block the attack

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Incredible. Shield raises your Armor Class to what? 18 damage-- -- was coming your way. 18 damage with a stipulation. As this hand reaches out to you, you can tell that this attack, before you Shield, the attack coming to you, this damage not only is necrotic damage, it lowers your HP maximum with each hit. If your HP maximum is ever lowered to zero, you are instantly killed.
segments.summary: The wraith's attack would have dealt necrotic damage and reduced max HP

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam)
segments.content: I would like to lodge a formal complaint. Objection. Just let it be known I object to this.

segments.speaker: Kattigan Vale (Robbie Daymond)
segments.content: Yes.

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: Plus?

segments.speaker: Tyranny (Whitney Moore)
segments.content: Plus, plus what? Plus, plus...

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: It'll say on your spell.

segments.speaker: Tyranny (Whitney Moore)
segments.content: Where'd I go? Where'd I go?

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: Plus seven.

segments.speaker: Tyranny (Whitney Moore)
segments.content: Plus seven.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Plus seven. Nine plus seven?

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: If you do not already.

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: Okay.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: But it's up to you. As you are surging forward in this moment, I think on you, but you're also with your size, I don't think you have anything like oil or an accelerant. I think you have flint and tinder, but I don't think you have anything like an accelerant, but you can also delay your turn initiative if you want to, if you want to collaborate with someone else.

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: And the lantern probably has kerosene in it or something.

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: Yeah. Fire! I need fire!

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: ♪ To the rain ♪

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Thimble, do you want to delay your turn until someone else can supply you with what you need?

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: Yeah, can I, I will-- Oh, he's at the very bottom. Kat, do you have, do you have a lantern on you? Anything?

segments.speaker: Kattigan Vale (Robbie Daymond)
segments.content: I have oil and flint, that's about it.

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: Okay, I need you to toss me your oil. You're after me, right? I'm going to delay my turn until Kat can--

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Cool.

segments.speaker: Kattigan Vale (Robbie Daymond)
segments.content: Keep me honest, give me one second. Yeah, I've got oil and a tinder box, flint.

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: Okay.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Hell yeah. So Kattigan goes right after you and the wraith is out of combat. So Thimble, you can absolutely-- Kattigan, you toss it through the air. Give me a DC 10 acrobatics as you toss this thing through the air.

segments.speaker: Kattigan Vale (Robbie Daymond)
segments.content: Oh, acrobatics? Okay, fingers crossed, here we go. Oh my god.

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: Can you Guide yourself?

segments.speaker: Kattigan Vale (Robbie Daymond)
segments.content: It's a four, but my acrobatics is a six.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Hey! DC 10, baby.

segments.speaker: Kattigan Vale (Robbie Daymond)
segments.content: He's a nimbly bimbly old man.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Thimble's on the other side of this tree from you, so you volley, huck this thing over this pine tree. Thimble, you see it cascading from the air.

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: I fly up.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Grab it. You are good to go. You have your full turn.

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: Then I'm going to fly forward.

segments.speaker: Kattigan Vale (Robbie Daymond)
segments.content: That's so sick.

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: And where the glyph was on the tree--

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Yeah.

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: Some of the dry viney situation--

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Yeah.

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: I'm going to try to (flint striking) and light the thing on fire.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Using your object action to dump the oil out all over the tree, you look out hearing the shambling of the dead, flying up the highest you have in this battle, you look out--

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: Oh god.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: At hundreds of bodies.

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: Oh jeez, Brennan.

segments.speaker: Kattigan Vale (Robbie Daymond)
segments.content: Yeah.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: In the forest, the oil comes--

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: Oh my god.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: -- pouring down the tree. I'm going to need a difficulty 15 sleight of hand. Lighting a fire with flint and tinder is not super easy.

segments.speaker: Kattigan Vale (Robbie Daymond)
segments.content: Yeah.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: So this will be a DC 15 sleight of hand.

segments.speaker: Kattigan Vale (Robbie Daymond)
segments.content: Come on!

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: That's a 25.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Oh baby!

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: Let's go!

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Finally!

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: Finally!

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Thimble getting down as fast as you can, in the vines, oil pouring down, within these vines, the skeletons of squirrels and rats and mice, some human skulls throughout, and you see desiccated gossamer wings.

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: (gasps)

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: It's time to go home. As you strike the flint, behind you on your back, the toy sword-- (bottle rocket whining) A bottle rocket, right as you strike the flint, sparks into the tree, and you look at the restless dead searching for a home, and the words "Welcome home" written in many bright colors race through the oil as fire of every color under the sun races over the tree. As the oil touches the rune, (explosion booming) (gasping) all of the undead fall to rest. You have won this combat.
segments.summary: Thimble successfully lights the oil on fire. The words "Welcome home" appear in bright colors as magical fire spreads over the tree, and when the oil touches the rune, all the undead fall to rest. The party has won the combat.

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: Oh my god. That is-- "Welcome home." Aah!

segments.speaker: Kattigan Vale (Robbie Daymond)
segments.content: Nice play. That's amazing.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: And as the fire spreads and casts its light, Teor, you look from side to side. As the heat fades from the lion head, you look, see them falling. You don't know what this could mean. The light that Wick can shine, the light coming from your flail, here in the dark forest, the light spreads from fireworks and flame itself, illuminating a glade with no sight of your brother. His body does not lie among the now restful dead. Where he is, and whether Soobri's vision of the fate that might await him is true, we will have to discover on next week's episode of Critical Role.
segments.summary: As the fire illuminates the forest glade, Teor sees the undead have fallen, but his brother's body is not among them. The party has won but the mystery of Teor's brother remains, as does the question of whether Soobri's vision will come to pass.

segments.content: Oh man.

segments.content: Popped off. We were popping off left and right and there'll be more popping off, and I just want to say from bottom of my heart, is it Thursday yet?
